notes: NT scan or dating scan (may be combined depending upon time of scan)
First Trimester biochemistry blood test: Pregnancy-Associated Plasma Protein-A, Free beta-hCG (part of a state’s Prenatal Screening Program)
Measurement of blood pressure each visit

STI (sexually transmitted infection) tests: gonorrhea, chlamydia, syphilis, HIV 
Infectious disease tests: Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, VZV (chicken pox), Rubella, TB (skin or blood test)
CBC (complete blood count, test for anemia), blood type screen (ABO and Rhesus factor), TSH (thyroid stimulating hormone)
Hemoglobin A1C (if high risk of gestational diabetes)
